result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard T. Jones was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court IMPOSES 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of extended supervision shall this sentence be imposed it is to be consecutive to any other sentence in being.
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance

miscConds.notes: --To pay fine of $1,500 + costs=  $2,908 plus blood testing costs in the amount of $56.74=$2,964.74 plus $33 in subpoena fees

--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--submit a DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: WSP

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes: --To serve   180 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 160  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order) Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:25am [mo]
Defendant Richard T. Jones in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court inquires of Mr. Jones' acceptance into the Alcohol Treatment Court; Atty. Svehlek indicates that the application has been submitted and but has not received approval
The Court conveys to Mr. Jones that shall he not be accepted into the Alcohol Treatment Court, the Court will allow him to withdraw his plea and redo sentencing from the beginning.

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of extended supervision.Shall this sentence be imposed it is to be consecutive to any other sentence in being.The Court finds Mr. Jones eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jones on Probation for a period of 3 years, with the following conditions:

  --To serve   180 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 160  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings
--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--To pay fine of $1,500 + costs= $2,908 plus blood testing costs in the amount of $56.74=$2,964.74 plus $33 in subpoena fees
--submit a DNA sample to designee upon demand

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Days Credit: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions warnings given
The Court assigns Atty. Svehlek to notify the Court of Mr. Jones' acceptance/ non-acceptance into the Alcohol Treatment Court
recess: 9:46am
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
State's theory of admissibility of blood test result

Case called at 3:47pm [mo]
Defendant Richard T. Jones in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Jones is anticipating being accepted into Alcohol Treatment Court, requests a status conference in October
The Court schedules a FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court reminds Mr. Jones that his bond and its conditions remain in effect
recess:3:52pm

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 10/13/15 at 9:00am (2)Jury Trial on 10/19 and 10/20/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 3:02 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Richard T. Jones in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Court confirms that address on file is accurate for Mr. Jones
Recess: 3:03 pm

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 7/22/15 at 10:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 8/7/15 at3:00 pm - Send notices
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:05am. 
Defendant Richard T. Jones in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Jones waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Teuber files the Information.
Attorney Svehlek requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding victim rights compliance, ADA Teuber indicates that it is not applicable in this case.
recess 9:08am. 
[the clerk verified wtih Mr. Jones that he remains at the Degnitz Road, Juneau address]

NEXT:  Arraignment on June 22nd at 9:00am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 09:20 am.

case called at 1:30-pm. [mo]
Defendant Richard T. Jones appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Jones is eligible for PD representation

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000  signature bond, with conditions:
 -  No possession or consume of alcohol  
-  Not go to any bars, taverns, liquor stores or establishments in which the primary function is the service of alcohol . 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 4/30/2015 at 1:30pm.

recess 1:42pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on May 20, 2015 at 9:2am  (2) Status Conference on May 26, 2015 at 3:00pm
